data.title: Home style!
data.text: Great food, great hospitality. Staff are friendly and make you feel welcome and at home. Food is delicious and affordable.

data.title: Great Food and Great Service
data.text: Awesome service and great food! The staff gave me excellent recommendations for lunch and the staff are very friendly. My to go order was completed very quickly.

data.title: awesome lebanese food!!!
data.text: I have been to Haddad's serveral times and thoroughly enjoy the lamb gyro, chicken shwarma and falafel. I think the most fun dish is the Haddad dinner which comes with all of these dishes as well as an assortment of dips and pita bread. I am particularly fond of the garlic sauce!!!

data.title: Very tasty sandwich, friendly staff
data.text: My colleagues and I decided to try this place for a late lunch. I had a delicious beef shawarma sandwich with parmesan fries. The sandwich was juicy and had the right amount of sauce. The server was friendly and attentive, and we had an informative conversation with the owner about his shawarma sandwiches.

data.title: Extensive menu with friendly staff
data.text: Visit this place when you are in town. It has a very extensive menu to meet almost any travelers needs.

data.title: Conference lunch
data.text: After a busy morning, I visited Haddad's with two colleagues from work.  The gyro and falafel was tasty and hot.  All and all, we had a great lunch and would return.

data.title: Lots of Flavor.
data.text: I have eaten at Haddad's many times over the last 20+ years. Food is always outstanding and service has always been friendly.

data.title: Great food and service (catered wedding reception)
data.text: My  son got married Dec. 2014, and their reception was catered by Haddad's.  The food was very tasty, and displayed very nicely, price was reasonable too.  They worked closely with my daughter-inlaw, to make sure everything was just right. I would use their services again

data.title: Lots of Good Food!
data.text:
We had our first experience at Haddad's Downtown for lunch. The staff is extremely personable, attentive, and proud of their cuisine. We decided to order the Haddad's Feast for two so we could get a good taste of their specialities. The platters came with enough food to feed four people! Everything was very tasty with just the right about of spices. 

The cabbage roll is not mushy like you see in so many other restaurants serving Lebanese cuisine. The flavor was excellent. The falafel and hummus were top notch. The tabouli is heavenly with a hint of onion and lemon. Both the gyro and chicken shwarma were excellent. We were provided with tahini, a wonderful homemade garlic sauce, and tzatzik. On top of that, our server brought us a basket of homemade potato chips that were crispy and flavorful. After a conversation with both of the owners, we were given a taste of the Italian beef which is probably the best in Peoria.

Come to downtown and give Haddad's Downtown a try for lunch, carry out, or catering. I don't think that you will be disappointed.

data.title: Wedding catering
data.text: I was the matron of honor at my best friend's wedding and Haddads catered. The food was amazing!!! Those cheesy mashed potatoes were to die for! The staff was the kindest, sweetest people I've met in a long time. Thank you for being so wonderful!

data.title: Hidden Gem of Downtown Peoria
data.text: We just had our first experience at Haddad's and it was everything you could want out of a quality establishment. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. We had the hummus which is fabulous and the schwarma which is top notch. Considering the surprisingly wide variety of restaurant options in the Peoria area Haddad's has carved out a great niche for serving excellent Greek style cuisine that cannot be rivaled. This is a place that genuinely cares about customer service and providing a great dining experience.Whats not to love?!

data.title: Excellent Gyro
data.text: Whenever we are downtown for events or meetings we have lunch at Haddad's.  We always receive great service and fabulous food.

data.title: Jury Duty
data.text:
I had the amazing fortune of serving Judy Duty at the amazing Peoria County Courthouse. During the lunch hours I stepped out into the sun and my eye's beheld, "Haddad's Downtown" I have had the luck to have eaten at the carts on the square a few times and have always been impressed so seeing a location that I could actually sit down in the warmth of the AC and enjoy a Gyro to wash the taste of the trial I was sitting on out of my mouth. 

Walking in I was promptly greeted with a warm hello and a smile. Always a plus. Ordered my usual and sat to wait. there was no real wait and the staff seemed to be having a great time and one of the young ladies looked over and asked me if I wanted to have some hummus while I waited. To be honest I have never tried it before never seemed that appealing which I remarked about. the sighed and reminded me that you should always at least try it first. 

I was amazed at the flavor and taste. So much that I ended up ordering that as well and didn't have room for the gyro.  Over all I was truly pleased with the whole experience. from the food, the staff, and the reminder that you should always try everything once. Never know when you might like something. 

I ended up spending the week on jury duty and had the fortune of spending my lunches at Haddad's trying multiple items on the menu and not once was disappointed. 

I highly recommend if you are in the area to stop in have a bite and even sample something new. You will not be disappointed.

data.title: Miranda lambert and rodney carrington event
data.text: Haddads always has great food and the day of the concert they were swamped! But the food was delicious and hot and the beers were cold! Awesome job!

data.title: Great Little Restaurant
data.text:
We were on our way to Omaha and stopped in Peoria. We found a quaint little restaurant for breakfast. We had the breakfast -- eggs, home fries, gyros meat, pita, hummus and tabouli. We ordered a gyros and an Italian beef sandwich to take on our trip. Everything was lovingly prepared and very fresh and tasty. They have an extensive Lebanese menu as well as American selections. Rita and Andrew, the owners, were delightful and went out of their way to ensure we had a great meal. They packaged all of the sauces separately so our sandwiches would be fresh when we opened them.

My husband is from Chicago and really liked the Italian beef sandwich -- even though it was not the traditional sliced Italian beef but rather more like a pulled pork sandwich. Andrew was very helpful in explaining the sandwich to make sure my husband would not be disappointed.

If we're ever back in Peoria, we'll be sure to stop by for a great meal.

data.title: Poor quality food served quickly and with a smile
data.text: This restaurant valiantly attempted to serve hundreds of hungry students and teachers during the ILMEA concert day in January.  Unfortunately, the quality of the food did not match the prices charged.  $10 for a small salad should be rather spectacular.  Instead, the salad was  served in a paper boat and consisted of yellow iceberg lettuce with a scoop of chicken salad on top.  Really nice people, trying to make a buck.  Now that they are making money, they need to move on to quality control.

data.title: What a gem
data.text: Yum, yummy, yummo, and any other variation of the word you can think of.  This is authentic lebanese food at it's best.  I have had the gyros, the hummus, tabouli, cabbage rolls, shwarma, lebanese green beans, lebanese chicken and rice (our favorite) kibbeh, and the falafel.  Every single menu choice you make at Haddad's is the right choice. Yes, they offer american options, and I am sure they are terrific too, however you are doing yourself a disservice if you opt for one of those over the authentic food.  Although, I must say that on a summer day nothing beats one of their pork chops and a tall lemon shake up.  They are the nicest couple (run by husband and wife) and their staff is fantastic.  They make it a point to remember you, remember what you like, and they always are glad to see you.  This is definitely one of Peoria's gems.

data.title: So good
data.text: We went to the irish fest and they had a stand there. They had the irish gyro which isn't usually on their menu but it was so good and melted in my mouth. My fiance had the porkchop, he said it was the best one he has ever had, so tender and juicy. We can't wait to go to their restuarant.

data.title: Awesome food!!!!
data.text: Everything I've tried from Haddad's is great!!! Today I had the Irish Gyro down at the Erin Feis festivities. They are at all of the events down at the Riverfront. It's a must to try something off of their menu.

data.title: Delicious Vegetarian Choices
data.text: I love the food and the people here! So nice and friendly ! I always order the salad with hummus, tabouli, and falafel. The rice stuffed cabbage leaves are also delicious.
